WRITING.TITLE: [WAR] Gonna get attacked by 26 max loons and 3 lvl1 lava hounds. Any base changes I could make to stand a chance in defending against that?

WRITING.TEXT: You have lvl1 pekkas. Looking at their defences, I would bet that they have lvl5 or 6 teslas. If they do, you will need heal and rage spells to have a chance. Lvl1 pekkas are so weak. I would just mass drag attack this base. Hit it from the south west and bring lvl6 loons in the cc if you can.

This sub hates in gowipe, but it's what I use and I 3 stared bases like this all the time when I was th8. I would attack from the north west. Drop a golem by the de drill and another by the top left elixir collector. Drop some wizards behind them (but not between them). Drop 2 pekkas plus a cc pekka on the spell factory. Some wall breakers, then your Bking, then a few wizards you have left over. Rage, heal, heal. That's what I would do and I would be confident about it. However, I also think hogs would work too. I just have never preferred hogs myself.

This is a really good explanation. So simple, yet I never really understood this before. Why would someone care if a star wars character is black? Ah, because they're only comfortable picturing black people serving them in the drive through. Anything beyond that makes them uncomfortable.
Really? Like what?

With max TH8 troops, this should be a pretty easy gowipe. I'd attack from the bottom right, by the CC. I never lure the CC, just kill it with wizards while it's hitting your golems. Bring 5-8 WBs and make sure to funnel the pekkas. You'll 3 star for sure.
That's probably the plan, but I'm worried about getting into the middle.

Very simple explanation: You're externally rotating your shoulders when the weight is overhead. You're probably sticking your head out and forward as well. Doing so pinches on a nerve that makes your hands go numb. I'm sure there's a much more scientific explanation, but I don't know it. Not a doctor, but I know that this is pretty common. This exact thing happened to me. I did a wod that had a lot of overhead squats at a decent weight (115lbs). My hands were numb for a few days afterward. After this happened, I realized that my overhead form is shit. I've been working on it ever since. Next time you do work overhead, focus on internally rotating your shoulders. Show your armpits to the person in front of you, not the people beside you. If you have trouble overhead squatting, or snatching, with internally toting your shoulders, then you need to lower the weight and work on form. I had to swallow my pride and do the same.

Can you get lvl4 hogs? You could send 4 hogs to take out the air sweeper. Zap the AD on the left. Then funnel the drags from the right. I think you should be able to 3 star it that way. Otherwise, bring 2 rage and a heal, 10 drags and your lvl5 CC loons. Attack from the top left. Be patient in taking out the outer buildings with a few drags, then funnel the rest in the middle. Rage, heal rage. Drop the spells once the drags start to funnel. It's better to drop the spells too early than too late.

What has been your challenge with pull-ups? Are you just trying to get kipping pull-ups, or have you been training to do them strict? I recommend that you really focus on this for the next few weeks/months. Do a set of 10 jumping pull-ups every time you're in the gym. Make your decent really slow and controlled. Then do a set of 10 banded strict pull-ups, using a thinner band once you succeed with a set. You should be able to get pull-ups in a month or two at most.

I'm in a small city, but not that small, and with a large crossfit community. Since getting into crossfit a few years ago, I've been really surprised by the lack of competitions, and the very few options for scaled athletes. The competitions in the city seemed to be geared towards the hardcore.

The idea is that there would be no classes. The box would exist purely for competitions. No classes means no coaches, which means I don't need to pay anyone. Judges would all be fellow competitors, or volunteers. Another goal would be that the gym is open during the day for free use by anyone who is in the league. I've noticed that a lot of people want open gym times, but their boxes don't provide enough. My facility would fill that need.

Good suggestions, thank you! As for scaled, I know what you mean. It's tough. At the competition I just competed in, there was a guy who could do 30 unbroken butterfly pull-ups. He came second last in the scaled div because he couldn't handle the weights in the other workouts. There were also 2 guys who snatched 200+ lbs and C amp;J 265. They also both finished near the bottom because they got crushed in the other events.

My city has the affiliate league too. I'm competing in it actually. I've been very unimpressed by the affiliate league. In my city, it's disorganized and difficult to schedule since its up to the competing boxes to find a time that works for up to 16 people. What I have in mind would operate more like a softball league. One location, one specific night of the week.

Thanks, I'll check it out. One of the main concepts of my facility would be that there are no regular members. There are no classes. It exists purely for competitions. However, someone else commented on an idea of having classes that are specifically focused on competition training. That's an idea I would consider.

I appreciate the comments. You're looking at this a bit differently than I am. People wouldn't need sponsors to compete in my crossfit league in the same way that people don't need sponsors to compete in rec softball, or beer league hockey. There would be a high level of competition in the RX div, but the scaled (and perhaps a "beginner" level) would be accessible to everyone.
Registering as an affiliate is a must, but why do you think I wouldn't be able to call it a crossfit competition? There's lots of crossfit competitions not organized by HQ.
This would explain why all the competitions I've heard of are called "throwdowns" or "challenges". Good to know.

Here's something that will help at least a bit: Put 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts on a tray. Put some olive oil, salt (just a bit) and pepper on them. You can put some other seasoning if you want. Put them in an oven preheated to 350f for 30min. While they're cooking, cut up all of the vegetables. What vegetables you ask? I said ALL of them. Just go to the produce section of your grocery store and buy 1 of everything that you like. Cut them all up into bite size pieces. Put them in a mixing bowl and squeeze some lime juice in there (this is to preserve the veggies). Get out 3 reusable containers (like ziplock or glassware or whatever). Fill each 3/4 way with your veggie mix. Put a layer of plastic wrap over them, then pour in some salad dressing. Get something oil based, not creamy. Now fold the plastic wrap over the dressing and put the lid on the container. Take the chicken out of the oven after 30min. Cut 1 of them into 3 equal pieces. Wrap 3 servings of 1.3 chicken breasts in tinfoil. You now have 3 meals consisting of a salad and 1.3 chicken breasts. It will keep for about 3 days in the fridge. This only takes about 35min to cook and is very cheap. You can do this a bunch of different ways including different types of veggies, different seasoning on the chicken, different meat etc. If you want to add some carbs to the meal, just bake a small sweet potato and add it to the meal. Enjoy!
Why do I even come to this sub anymore?
Like everyone else has said, your troops aren't even close to ready for TH9. Unless you gem, you probably have at least a month left at TH8. Maybe more.

Are the inferno towers set to single or multi? I'm a TH9 that hasn't had to attack too many TH10s, so I can't tell just by looking at them. If my clan only needed 2 stars from this base in the war, I would gowipe it and just rage, heal, rage, heal everything into the middle. Pretty sure you'd get the TH doing that. The walls and defences are so low lvl. If we needed 3 stars, I would probably use gowiwi, but only if the infernos are set to multi. If it's set to single, I'd try lavaloonion with 3 hounds. To be honest though, I wouldn't expect to 3 star it myself, and probably wouldn't try. I'd just gowipe it for 2 stars. I have very little experience hitting TH10s, so you'll probably get better advice from others.

The concept of using your own base as a way to test your offensive power is something that took a while for me to get across to my clan. It's such an easy way to know if you are rushing your defences.

Do you have access to a high lvl golem for your CC? Do you have 220 troop capacity? If so, I would gowiwipe from 2oclock with lots of WBs. Id rage the WBs to make sure they succeed. You'll need a really good funnel to ensure the pekkas don't wander around the base.

There are lots of legitimate complaints you can make about crossfit and its many interpretations, but this isn't one of them. Doing a 1 rep max overhead squat with perfect form is impossible. It's one of the most challenging lifts there is, and these are very experienced lifters going for their highest possible weight. The numbers they put up are crazy.

I don't see a problem with it. I see a very talented lifter playing around with some funky techniques that he is obviously very confident in performing. It's for fun. Nobody is suggesting that this is some new and improved technique that people should try. Look at the comments on the "CrossFit Pushups" post on the front page. There's some serious stupidity going on in that thread. Who gives a shit what the haters think. I for one am glad I got to see this cool video.

In the future, please include a picture of your troops and spells in the comments of your post. A lot easier for us that way. Your only option is to mass drag. Bring 2 rage and a heal spell (assuming they're at least lvl3). Attack from 2oclock on the map. You need to funnel well. If you don't know what I mean by that, Google "dragon funnelling" and watch videos. Clear as many buildings as you can at 1oclock and 3oclock with 1 or 2 drags at each of those spots. Once you've created a good funnel, drop the rest of your drags at 2oclock. Use rage, heal, rage on them as they make their way to the middle. It's better to use your spells too early, rather than too late. You can't heal dragons that are dead. Just make sure to drop the spell on, but a bit ahead of the drags. Ask for a dragon in your CC. Good luck!
This is what I was going to say as well. It's a problem I have myself. I pull so high that I might as well powersnatch it.

WRITING.TITLE: [MISC] What is the best cross-platform chat app, and what are some good tips for using it?
WRITING.TEXT: My clan has grown significantly and we have now reached 50 users. We have a very solid war record (45-3-4), because we've always had great communication and strategy. During the cleanup round of attacks, I will send a clan mail with specific instructions for everyone who can have an impact on the war at that time. I tell them who to attack, in what order and who is in reserve for back attacks. As you can probably imagine, this is now very difficult to do with 50 members. It's mainly the character limit in the clan mail that makes things difficult. I actually really enjoy coming up with a detailed war plan and watching it get us the win (last night we beat a lvl7, 100+ win clan by a single star). What apps do people use, and what are some effective methods of using them? I would like to have a chat room for the whole clan, and a private room for leaders. Notification settings will be important as I don't want hundreds of notifications per day. Image sharing is also important. Does anyone have any tips on not only the app to use, but how to use it most effectively?

I've seen this base a few times recently. I recommend GoWiWi. Bring a max golem in your CC if you have access to one. Bring lots of witches. I'd say 10. I recommend bringing 3 heals and 1 rage. You wanna use the rage to kill the drag that's probably in the CC, but only heals after that. You never want to rage witches as it can speed them up into the path of defences or giant bombs.

My base looked very similar to yours when I upgraded to TH9. Hold off. Upgrade your walls. Trust me, it's very difficult to upgrade your walls when you have so many new defences to upgrade. Also, you should practice GoWiPe with lvl2 golems for a few weeks before you go to TH9. Get REALLY good at it. My clan has a max TH8 that can 3 star low level TH9s in war with his GoWiPe and it's incredibly valuable. Be patient.

I just setup Slack as it allows for custom usernames, which is important so people can use their CoC names, and it doesn't require a phone number or anything. Seems to allow for anonymity. The draw feature would be great though. Not sure if Slack has that. Does your app require a bunch of personal info to signup?

Typically, you should upgrade your archers, then giants, then Wiz, then WBs, then dragon. Once they're all maxed, do a healer upgrade while you save for the pekka upgrade. I'm assuming you're very new to TH8. If you war a lot, then dragons are your top priority. Get them to lvl3 as fast as possible. If war isn't as important to you, follow the order above.
Do this, and it's an easy 3. This base is setup for GoHo.

First it seems like just a fun little game. You spend a few minutes playing now and then because it's a good time waster. After a while you find yourself enjoying it more and more. You've figured out how the attacks work and how to build a good base to defend your loot. "This is fun!" You think to yourself. A few weeks later and your base is coming along. You built your first air defence to take out those flying fairy things this people use to keep their Giants alive longer. You're determined to get one yourself. You start learning how to attack different types of bases and you love the rush you get from scoring some big loot. Then you find a clan. Maybe you found them in global chat. Maybe you found out that a bunch of guys at your work play too. You take part in your first clan war... And fail miserably. You're determined to pull your weight and do better next time. A few months later and you know everything there is to know about dragon attacks. You consistently get 3 stars, but it's getting boring. "I just wanna GoWiPe!!" You say to yourself and your clan. So you grind, day and night to get those pekkas. Then things start to get interesting. It's been a year, and you're a solid TH9. You use GoHo attacks when it suites you, but maybe you prefer LaLoon or even DragLoon, cause you just love those air attacks. Or maybe your a witch guy, and you prefer GoWiWi. You're in a solid clan and you're near the top. Everything is maxed but your walls and Royals. Things are getting stale again. You decide to go to TH10. You think you're ready, and your clan mates agree. Time to enter the big leagues. You set the TH to upgrade, and you're crazy excited. A few weeks pass and finally you've made it... TH10. You expected it to be a bit different at TH10. The TH8s are no longer goo options for loot. You can't get 2 stars in war to save your life. Every defence, wall, or royal upgrade takes weeks to grind for. You're getting frustrated, but you're don't want to give up. You've invested almost 2 years into this game. You notice yourself playing less. You login for war attacks, but can't be bothered to farm. You've just lost the spark. After a long period of contemplation, you decide that you've had enough. CoC was great for a while, and a blast while it lasted, but the fire has burned out. You open your base and let the loot out into the world. So long CoC, it's been a slice. A few weeks go by and things are well. You miss wars a bit, but you don't think about CoC nearly as much. You've even met a new girl and you think she likes you. It's Friday night and you have a date. You got ready too early cause you're so excited for the date. You have some time to kill so you open up Reddit. You keep forgetting to unsubscribe from /r/clashofclans, and so there it is, at the top of your front page... ClashCon is underway. You figure you might as well see what the big upgrade was. TH11! Wow, that's cool. You know how much of a grind it would be, and you kinda chuckle at all of the people clamouring to get it. Then you see the other upgrades: expanded map, new Royal, new DE troops, new DE spells, water troops?! Holy shit, water troops! "That's awesome!!" You think to yourself. You gotta login, just to check it out. A few hours later and you get an angry text from the date you forgot all about. Too bad, she was cute. Oh well, you only need 8,000,000 more elixir to get the new turtle rider tank troop. Maybe just a few more attacks...

The xbows are set to ground, I'm gonna use a golem and wiz to take out the AQ and CC. The other 2 AD are also lvl4, and pretty exposed for loons. I think it will work.

I use this base as one of my war bases. I've never been 3 stared by a TH9 with lower than lvl15 Royals. You could do it though. My DGBs are between the AD and wiz tower at the top right, and I modified the sweepers on the bottom to fit DGBs there. This person hasn't done that. So I suspect that there is probably single giant bombs between the sweepers and a DGB setup between the AD and wiz tower at either the top right or left.
Neither make sense. Revenue - cost = profit. A higher revenue to cost ratio would equal higher profit.

Notice the high level of the bases he's attacking, and the lvl of his troops and royals. If you're attacking a similar level base, but you have lvl10 heroes and lvl1 hounds, you'll fail. If you're attacking newer TH9s with those troops, you'll fair better. When in doubt, gowipe.

Well, it really depends on where you are in your progress, and where your clan is in its overall progress. My clan has several relatively new TH9s. We all maxed out at TH8 before upgrading. All of our TH8s have great troop levels, and are in various stages of non-rushed progression. Right now, we are matching up against a lot of clans with very high lvl TH9 bases (significantly higher than our top TH9s), but mixed in with a bunch of low lvl and rushed TH8s. In pretty much every war, we 3 star every TH8 easily. We 3 star a few TH9s, but have no possible hope of 3 staring the enemy's top TH9s. They are significantly higher lvl than we are. Therefore, our strategy is to get 2 stars on these bases. We use a lot of GoWiPe and GoWiWi for almost guaranteed 2 stars. This is results in us basically never losing. Our record is 51-6-5. It's not a perfect record, but it's a damn good one. The guy I replied to said that he's a TH9 that is "terrible in war". Maybe he should focus on consistently getting 2 stars for a while, until he gets his royals and troops up. But what do I know, I just go for 2 stars all the time. Such a losing strategy right? Not according to my clan's war record.

For sure. I wouldn't gowipe attack a base that's already been 2 stared, because gowipe is a 2 star attack. We've been struggling recently at the top of the board because we've been trying to use more advanced attacks, but are failing because our royals aren't high enough yet. With lvl1 lavahounds and lvl11 royals, it's really tough to 3 star bases with defences that are maxed for TH9 and royals in the 20+ range. We often get matched up with clans that have maxed out bases at the top, and a mix of rushed and low lvl bases below. We pretty much always win, but I'm missing the satisfying feeling of getting 3 stars. I've realized that I can't expect to start getting 3 stars until I have golems, lavahounds, and witches that are maxed for TH9, along with royals that are at least lvl15+. Until then, I'll just need to be satisfied with gowiping for 2 stars.

WRITING.TITLE: Just finished the final book and have a question about a potential ending that never came to be. [Spoilers All]
WRITING.TEXT: What would have happened if the Crimson King made it to the top of the tower? Would he have opened the final door and had his consciousness transplanted into Roland's body at the time of the start of The Gunslinger? That would be interesting.

I think it's pretty amazing that the triplets he met at the Crimson King's castle told him that he had saved the tower, and the beams. That the destroyed beams would regenerate. That the Crimson King would be trapped on the balcony forever. He had accomplished his mission. He could turn back knowing that the lives he had sacrificed would not be in vein. But he couldn't. He had to see it, and in doing so, he sacrificed 1 more life: Oy. For that sacrifice, he would need to try again.
Yes, Red Dead was my first thought. The guy fighting in that game was really well done. Improve it a bit more and that's a great foundation for a DT game.

Lightsaber fights have always looked so stupid to me. Each strike is so clearly thrown to be blocked or dodged. It's something I hope the new trilogy gets right. It would be dangerous to the actors and stunt crew, but the general idea of a choreographed Lightsaber fight should be that if you mess up and miss a step, you're gonna get hit with the stick, because it's being swung to hit you, should you not block it.
It's Chewie unfortunately. She's crying over a dead Chewie. :(

Yoda was a great Jedi trainer, but a terrible leader. I blame him for the fall of the Jedi, and the Republic. Not because he wasn't able to figure out Palpatine's plan though. I blame Yoda because of his absolutely colossal failure with Anakin. Regarding Palpatine, I've always been torn between Yoda being a blind fool, and Palpatine just being a master of manipulation, and of the force. I tend to lean towards the latter, because non of the other Jedi were able to figure it out either. Regarding Anakin, Yoda just completely screwed up. Here is this kid that was conceived by the force itself, who is immensely strong in the force, and who they all agree is the chosen one. Who do they have train him? Not Yoda, or Windu. Not Mundi or Fisto or any of the other masters. No, they get fresh faced Kenobi, who himself just lost his master and just graduated from Padawan to Knight. A line that always stuck with me from episode 3, "You were my brother Anakin!" Anakin didn't need a brother. He needed a master. When Padme needed protecting, why the hell would they choose Anakin? He's already shown to be emotional, brash and undisciplined. Also, he's clearly in love with her. They must have sensed that. Why would they send them off to Naboo to be alone together?! Anakin even goes to Yoda and tells him of his visions, of his fear of loss. Here is arguably the most powerful Jedi EVER, telling Yoda some pretty heavy shit, and Yoda just casually tells him to let it all go. Doesn't follow up, doesn't look to mentor him further or do anything else to help the clearly heavy emotional state of the chosen one. There are so many mistakes that Yoda made with Anakin, and without Anakin, Palpatine wouldn't have been able to accomplish his goals. I mean, Mace Windu did hand Palpatine his ass in that fight. I still love Yoda though. I just think he should have stuck with training the younglings.
Holy shit! At 6:45 in the video, Anakin's pod racer is stalled at the starting line. Watch Jar Jar clearly use the force to get the pod racer started. Seriously, I have chills right now.

There's only 1 point where that happens, and it kinda makes sense. The point where they enter the larger room, Ventress attacks Dooku and the other 2 night sisters look kinda lost. They're not force users (to the extent of a Jedi or sith), have very little experience with lightsabers and are watching 2 of the best go at it. Eventually they gain the courage to jump in, but it took a clear opening. I don't really blame them. They're fighting one of the most powerful force users in the galaxy, and arguably the best Lightsaber duelist alive. They're attacking him 3 on 1, he's fucking blind, and he's still defending everything they throw at him.
Really? I was so happy they brought him back. There's a villain that deserves an actual back story.
Unfortunately that body is Chewie.
Supreme Leader Snoke is the main villain. Kylo is a puppet.

Really? That's great! I'll need to take another look. That would make a lot more sense actually. Harrison wanted to be killed off in ROTJ but Lucas wouldn't allow it. Chewie is a character that is easy to put into future movies. Harrison doesn't seem that excited about anything these days, other than crashing planes onto golf courses. I bet Harrison asked to be killed off. Chewie is gonna go ape shit. I suspect some arms might be torn off.
True. I can't imagine that they would make the same mistake as TPM, and kill off the cool villain at the end of movie 1, so it's safe to assume that Kylo will be around until at least episode 8.

Keep this in mind: The Emperor never even imagined the possibility of losing the battle on Endor's forest moon, and then the space battle above. The Emperor fully expected all of Luke's friends and the entire rebellion to be destroyed in front of his eyes. If this had happened, Luke would have had no choice other than to join the Emporer, or die. Of course he would have chosen death, and I agree that there wasn't much evidence to suggest he would have chosen differently, but just keep in mind that when the Emperor of orchestrated his plan, Luke having any kind of life to choose, other than the dark side, was not in the cards.

-Seeing how incredibly powerful the Emperor is. Not just in combat, but as a true master of all aspects of the dark side of the force. He manipulated the entire galaxy, and he did it right under the nose of the greatest Jedi master to ever live. He is brilliant, ruthless, and completely without mercy. He is the greatest villain in cinema history IMO, and I never would have fully understood that if it wasn't for the PT. -Understanding the sadness, regret, and shame that Yoda and obi-wan felt. Their failures directly resulted in the fall of the Jedi order, and of the Republic. In the OT, Yoda was this great and wise Jedi master with no faults. The PT allowed us to see his failures and makes episode V so much more powerful when you understand his regrets. When Luke leaves to confront Vader, you really see Yoda's disappointment, thinking that he had failed yet again. I have SO much more, but I gotta get back to work. Maybe I'll add more later.

This is based on a few things: He's been described as a tall, reptilian like species with a cobra like head. I see that Disney is trying to tie a lot of things together using their comics. I had never heard of Kellarens until I read the Kanan comics. For anyone who has read them, this is will be an interesting, though really unimportant tie to the comic. To the average viewer who hasn't read the comic, this will be a brand new species they've never seen before. I'm not suggesting that Snoke is any of the Kellarens that have been introduced in the comic, I just noticed that they happen to look exactly like the description that we've been given of Snoke.

Kellarens are entirely new to the universe. The first and only time they've ever appeared was in a Kanan comic that just came out a few weeks ago. That's one of the main reasons why I think it fits; the description is exact, and if the comic writers were looking for a new species to introduce, why not use a species that will first be introduced in the movie coming out in a few weeks.

WRITING.TITLE: [WAR] My clan only ever matches with clans from the Philippines. Why?

Define "count". We know that a squadron of Vader's elite Stormtroopers boarded the rebel ship. That's canon. In previous Star Wars licensed games, we learned that it was the 501st. Do you think that the team at Disney has rewritten the squadron name? Like, did they actually take the time to go through every single piece of Star Wars material, find anything that overlaps with the movies, and write a statement making it no longer true? Do you think that JJ Abrams would say, "No, that wasn't the 501st. That's not canon anymore. No no, it was the 502nd." This whole argument about "canon" is so stupid. The idea behind making anything outside of the movies and animated shows uncanon was that anything that doesn't make sense with the new story, like the Yuzon Vong, or Palpatine's clones, is not official, so that Disney doesn't have to cater to it. I don't think anyone actually had the idea in mind to erase aspects of the story that make perfect sense, that were expanded upon in other mediums, but that's all I keep seeing people saying any time anything interesting outside of the movies is brought up. But yes, one could argue that you are technically correct. Since Battlefront 2 is no longer canon, we can't officially state that the 501st (Vader's Fist) was the squadron that boarded the rebel ship in ANH. Instead, we'll just assume that it was some nameless, insignificant group of Stormtroopers with no backstory, and nothing interesting about them at all. That's way more fun.

Dude, you're very confused. The Lightsaber in Force Awakens is blue. It was Anakin's Lightsaber, and then became Luke's Lightsaber when it was given to him by Obi-Wan. It was dropped off the bridge on Cloud City when Luke's hand was cut off by Vader in episode 5. Nobody knows how it was recovered, or how Maz got her hands on it. This is probably gonna get buried and you won't see it, but I'll comment anyways. We have tested many strategies and have decided on what we believe is the best one: Every TH10 and TH9 hits their mirror. The bottom 2 TH9s also hit their -2. Everyone below TH9 hits their -2. The bottom 2 bases hit their mirrors and try to push everyone else up. Round 2 is cleanup. For a while, that involved me sending out clan mail with specific attack instructions. Now, people have started to understand how to count available attacks above and below them, and make the correct cleanup attack. We very rarely ever lose. We've lost 1 war out of the last 10 or 15 wars, and we lost via the tie-break percentage to a much tougher clan.

Anyone who doesn't train has no business criticizing any training method. So if someone can't tell you their what their max lifts are (or at least give an estimate based on their programming), then there's no point in even listening to what they have to say. People who do train, but repeat the criticisms about crossfit stated in this article either have a motive (remember that lady's article last year bashing crossfit, while promoting her own fitness program, that got millions of hits), or they're just willingly ignorant about what crossfit really is. Either way, I have no time for them if they're not a part of my life. I don't give a shit what people on the internet think about anything. I have some friends that lift in regular gyms. Strong dudes. When I started crossfit, they made fun of me relentlessly. It was pretty easy to shut them up. I just went to the gym with them, followed their program (with perfect form on the lifts), lifted about as much as them (more than some, less than others), and when we were done for the day, I challenged them to a max strict pull-up challenge. They never made fun of crossfit around me again. In fact, one of them converted after I cleaned his 5x10 deadlift weight.

I think 3 stars is a long shot with a ground attack because your heroes are a bit low. Most people won't agree with me, but I would go for 2 stars in your situation. I would bring 2 golems, 2 pekkas, 2 witches, 8 wiz, 4 WBs, 9 hogs and 1 archer, with max wiz in the CC. Bring 2 heals, a rage and a jump. Lure the CC with a hog and drop a couple poisons on whatever comes out. Attack from the queen side. Drop the golems and then the wiz to make a funnel. Drop the WBs once you know they'll get through. Next comes the pekkas, BK, queen, witches and CC wiz. Rage them all inside, but try to avoid raging the witches. Use the jump to get them in the core. Send the hogs last. Use 1 heal on the bulk of the troops, and the other on the hogs. I've never failed to get a high percentage 2 star with this attack, and have surprised myself with a few 3 stars on max bases when I was around your lvl.

Rent. Your situation doesn't seem to stable. I don't mean that in a bad way, it just doesn't sound like you intend to stay in your current location for long. So rent, invest the extra money coming in, and stay highly liquid for now. Opportunities for ownership will be available when you're a bit more settled.

Yes, but it's much easier to get out of a 1 year lease, than it is to gout out of a 25yr+ mortgage. The laws depend on your location, but it's usually very easy to find a tenant to take over your lease. When you buy, you then need to sell, which means paying an agent commission, property taxes etc. If you don't intend on staying in a place for at least 5yrs (10yrs is ideal), renting is the better option.

WRITING.TITLE: Bronn's joust against the Dothraki mirrors his joust victory in AFFC, and it's awesome.
WRITING.TEXT: When Bronn named Lollys Stokeworth's bastard son after Tyrion, Cersei sent Ser Balman Byrch to kill him. Thinking that Bronn was an unskilled cut-throat, Balman challenged him to a duel and chose to joust, figuring that jousting is a knight's skill and it would be an easy win. Bronn was smart and took out Balman's horse with his lance, instead of fighting "honourably". Bronn has made a career out of killing knights who are foolish enough to fight honourably. Seeing Bronn fight Dothraki was awesome. You could tell that he knew what kind of savagery the Dothraki would bring when he told Jamie to gtfo of there. No sly tricks we're going to cut it against them. Even knowing that, the move the Dothraki pulled in his charge against Bronn was fucking awesome. Dropping down below Bronn's swipe and cutting hit horse's leg off. Damn. That was the highlight of the episode for me.

Thanks. There were so many awesome details in this episode. I've been kinda disappointed by this season so far but this episode was stellar, and not just because the battle was sweet. It's the little things that made it great. Edit: "No one" (Syrio Forel confirmed FM in my head canon) "Chaos is a ladder". Nice touch. "Fewer". Davos remembers the Mannis. "I'm not a !... Thanks Podrick". Nice little reference to Podrick's constant, "yes Ser? .. My Lady?" In the books. "King Snow, isn't it? No, that doesn't sound right...". Davos knows what's up. King Targaryen sounds a bit better.

For anyone in BC waiting for their application to be approved, I spoke with the CFP office today and they told me that the BC CFO is under heavy applicant volume and is about 2-3 weeks behind. That means that once your application has been sent to the CFO for final approval, expect another 4-5 weeks.
Stop writing reddit comments about yourself and finish the damn book George! ;)

The office in Mirimachi does the initial application processing, which I believe includes background checks and the scanning of the license picture. All of the information gets entered into their system, which is then sent to the CFO in your province. The CFO does a background check and final approval before your license is printed and mailed to you from there. That #8217;s what I was told by the CFP staff in Mirimachi, though I may be wrong about background checks being done in both places. The key part of this for BC residents right now is that the BC CFO is apparently very backlogged right now. So once it gets to them, there #8217;s about 4-6 weeks wait, instead of 2-4 weeks like usual.

If you #8217;re waiting for the application to be processed, call the license office and ask to be transferred to your Province #8217;s CFO in order to inquire about your application status. I did so today, and my license was issued an hour later. My application was received on 03/28. It #8217;s been sitting in a state of #8220;processing #8221; since 04/25. I called the office in Manitoba today and they told me to call back in 4 weeks of it still hasn #8217;t changed. 4 more weeks! I asked to be transferred to the CFO in my province. I spoke with a nice dude at the CFO office who told me it was in the final stage and he would check to see if there were any issues. After he checked, he told me there were no problems and I should expect the license to be issued soon. An hour later and it was approved and sent out. Call the CFO. It #8217;s worth it.

Depends on the rifle and parts, but mostly depends on your comfort level with tools. Installing a foregrip on a rifle with a rail system is so easy, anyone can do it. Installing a new stock on an old surplus rifle (like an SKS) looks easy on YouTube, but I discovered yesterday that it #8217;s a lot harder than it looks. I had to file down a bunch of parts and i was very nervous doing so. However, this is still considered easy. Dismantling a new rifle and installing a new stock can be very difficult if you don #8217;t know what you #8217;re doing.

I don #8217;t think it matters to the story. I do think it #8217;s worthwhile as far as enjoying the topic being discussed. I love speculating and dissecting the books. We #8217;re saying the same thing, just with different words. My definition of #8220;matters #8221; in this case is whether or not something will affect the story, not whether or not it will affect our interpretation of it. Let #8217;s say that Brandon is Domeric #8217;s father. That isn #8217;t going to matter (based on my definition of the word) as it #8217;s never going to impact anyone or any event in the story. However, it does change our interpretation of events, and how we react to them, which is great. It just doesn #8217;t matter in terms of actual story direction.

Call the Alberta CFO. You #8217;ll need to go through The main CFP line: 1-800-731-4000. Ask them about the status of your application. They will tell you that it #8217;s completed initial processing and is with the Alberta CFO. Ask to be transferred to the Alberta CFO. They #8217;ll do it no problem. Once you speak with the CFO, you #8217;ll find out if anything is amiss. Most likely they will tell you everything looks good, but the process of calling them will bump your application to the top of the pile and speed up the process. The CFP person I spoke with said it would be an additional 2-4 weeks. I got transferred to the CFO, spoke with them for 5min, and the next day my license was mailed out.

I love my MK22 SCAR .22LR. I #8217;ve put 1000+ round through it in the month I #8217;ve owned it and it #8217;s never jammed. A simple red dot sight and it #8217;s super accurate. I get tight groupings at about 40m. There #8217;s no magazine capacity limit and you can mount pretty much anything on it. My buddies made fun of me relentlessly when I bought it, but now it #8217;s one of my group #8217;s favourite guns to shoot. https://www.gotenda.com/shop/firearms/rifles/issc-mk22-scar-22lr-non-restricted/

I highly recommend a Canik TP9SF for your first pistol. https://www.cabelas.ca/product/110153/canik-tp9sf-semi-auto-9mm-pistol It #8217;s an incredibly high quality gun for the price. Also, it feels great. The size and weight is just right, and the trigger is fantastic for a stock trigger. I #8217;ve only put about 500 rounds through mine, so it #8217;s still new, but if you have any doubt about the reliability, watch this ridiculous video: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=mfUP75Je-IM Edit: I should mention that I am a new shooter, and have only fired about 10 handguns, and a total of about 2000 rounds, but I do love my Canik.

My advice is to be patient. Believe me, I understand why you #8217;re stoked. Once you register for the course, it #8217;s pretty much all you think about. I #8217;ve been there. Keep in mind, you have a lot of waiting to do. There #8217;s the waiting to do the course, then there #8217;s waiting to submit the application, then there #8217;s waiting to see it appear online, then there #8217;s waiting for approval, then there #8217;s waiting for the license to arrive. If everything goes perfectly, you have a few months to wait before you even get your license. Then you need to buy your first restricted, then there #8217;s more waiting for your transfer to be approved, then there #8217;s waiting for your ATT. By all means, do as much research and learning as makes you happy, but just remember that there #8217;s a lot of waiting involved. Go do some drop-ins at a local range in the meantime. It #8217;ll help to scratch the itch, and you #8217;ll develop preferences that will assist in those crucial first few purchases.

The description of #8220;the workers control the means of production #8221; seems like it was written 100+ years ago (I assume it was?) because it just doesn #8217;t make sense to me in a modern world. It sounds like you #8217;re describing a farm or a factory where people are the primary source of energy to produce goods. With farming and factories being almost completely autonomous, what would the #8220;workers #8221; actually do in a socialist society? Also, if everyone needs to be trained and educated on all of the more complex roles, in order to allow for informed #8220;voting #8221; on company decisions, who does the shitty jobs? If you have 2 people at an engineering firm with equal knowledge of the industry they work in, who does the engineering work, and who cleans the toilettes? I can #8217;t wrap my mind around true socialism. I feel like a more realistic utopia would be Star Trek #8217;s society: everything is automated, everything is autonomous, all needs are provided for and nobody #8220;works #8221;. We all just play the trombone and come up with cool ways to sit in chairs while wearing silk robes n shit.

What would be an example of a #8220;fair #8221; distribution of stock amongst employees? Is it even, or would it be based on skills, experience, etc? I #8217;m assuming there would need to be a governing body that enforced the distribution to ensure that all companies adhere to the mandated percentages? What about the initial investment to start the business? Does that affect the distribution of ownership? For example, my friend owns a small wine touring company. It #8217;s basically a half dozen vans driving people from winery to winery. In order to start the business, she needed to take out a small business loan and combine it with her savings to buy the vans, build a website, buy some advertising and hire drivers. She put every dollar she had into the business. Do the drivers she hired get to own an equal share of the company? Furthermore, what happens when the company expands? She wants to buy 6 more vans and hire 6 more drivers. Does that mean that my friend and the first 6 drivers get their shares split in half to accommodate the new hires? In this system, why would anyone start a business? Why put up your own money or take out loans. Why take on the risk when you can just get a low skill job and still own part of the business? There are currently 28 million small business owners in the US. Can you imagine convincing them to give up ownership of their companies? That #8217;s why real socialism will never happen. You would need armed intervention to take the business by force. I like my Star Trek idea better.

Did you replace any parts? I just picked one up and it #8217;s giving me problems. Every other round jams. A guy at the range who knows his shit told me that the spring is way too high tension and that I should replace it. He told me to basically replace anything that #8217;s easy to do so. Have you experienced any failure to eject or jams of any kind so far?

Hand loaded ammo, as in, loading each round by hand? Yes, I am, and finding it quite difficult actually. I #8217;m gonna order new magazines cause the stock ones don #8217;t seem very smooth. I thought that the magazine, or the way I loaded the rounds was the issue, until I had a guy watch me shoot it. He told me that the spring is so high tension, that it #8217;s actually bouncing back, and catching the casing before it ejects. It sounded unlikely, but it kinda makes sense, because the casings are ejecting all over the place. One flew straight back and hit me in the forehead. Apparently it #8217;s because the ones that do eject, get clipped by the slide on its way backX and throws it off course. Hopefully new magazines and a new spring will solve the issue.

Not really. AFFC was released in 2005. At that time, much of ADWD had already been written. That #8217;s why George said it would be out the following year. So if we #8217;re being generous, and say he only wrote ADWD content for a year before releasing AFFC, that means that he was writing ADWD 14 years ago. Unfortunately, he never finished it. The first bit of TWOW is just the ending of ADWD, which is the same book as AFFC, considering the location split. Therefore, in the past 18 years since the release of ASOS, we #8217;ve gotten 3/4 of one book in the main story line.

There is no scaled leaderboard. It #8217;s a single leaderboard. If you do 1 rep rx, and I do 100 scaled, you are ahead of me on the leaderboard.

That one workout you did RX will put you above the highest scaled person, for that particular workout. It will all contribute to your rank. Don #8217;t overthink it. Just do either RX or scaled depending on what you can do. You will end up on the overall leaderboard wherever you fall. Doing 1 or 2 RX workouts isn #8217;t going to bump you off of some other leaderboard.

From what I #8217;ve read and heard, it seems like Greg Glassman (founder of CrossFit) decided that he doesn #8217;t want CrossFit to be an event company, or a media company. So they are no longer producing the coverage of the open or hosting regionals. They are now opening the ability for 3rd party companies to host #8220;sanctioned #8221; CrossFit events, which they have been very aggressively against in the last. Think about it like the opposite of RedBull, which was a drink manufacturer that sponsored sporting events, until one day, they woke up and realized that they are in fact a media company. CrossFit, on the other hand, makes a bunch of money from affiliates and courses, but hasn #8217;t been able to find profit in its media arm. So, they gave up and are gonna let other people take over that portion. Overall, it probably a good idea, but if this open announcement is any indication, they don #8217;t really have a plan in place. Another good comparison is UFC, which is now on ESPN. This is HUGE for that sport. They don #8217;t need to focus on PPV for all their main events, and instead can rely on the worlds biggest sporting media company. CrossFit better pray that somebody comes along and picks up the pieces of their media and event wings, cause if nobody does, we may see the end of CrossFit as a competition.

WRITING.TITLE: (Spoilers Extended) How many of us find the White Walkers story line to be a boring distraction from what made the show great?
WRITING.TEXT: I already knew that the next season is going to be focused on the White Walker invasion and the Night King, but seeing the trailer still bummed me out. It #8217;s too bad that a story about political intrigue with an emphasis on strong character development has turned into a Dragons vs Zombies CGI fest. I #8217;m really hoping that maybe they will resolve the White Walker story line within 3 episodes, and the rest of the season will be about the characters fighting to pick up the pieces and sit on the thrown of ashes.

Within the story, the politics and fighting between the houses was a distraction from the real threat, that #8217;s definitely true. However, the politics and character development was what made the show great. If GoT started as a Dragons vs Zombies show, I #8217;m sure it still would have gained a following, but it never would have appealed to such a broad audience. My gf (now ex) used to be beyond excited for every episode. She doesn #8217;t even watch the show anymore.
Some people seem to think it will get resolved in 3 episodes, some say 5. I #8217;m hoping for 3.

The characters weren #8217;t aware of them because they barely existed in the story, never mind driving the main story line. I bet the white walkers and their whites took up less then 0.01% of screen time until season 5. My point is that the show was better when it was about the human heart in conflict with itself, not cgi zombies battling cgi dragons.

You can disagree with my disappointment that the show has turned into a cgi dragon vs zombie battle, but you can #8217;t disagree that it has only recently become that. The show was about strong character development, riveting dialogue, and the human heart in conflict with itself. That #8217;s what made it popular. Just because the trajectory of the show was always leading to the shallow, uninspiring, plot hole ridden cgi fest we have now doesn #8217;t mean that #8217;s what it #8217;s always been.

I would agree with that assessment. I think part of the reason is that the night king and white walkers have no character at all. We don #8217;t know their motivations, their strategy, their fears. Think back to the battle of the blackwater. Part of the reason it was amazing was that we had vested interest in both sides. I wanted to see Stanis take the thrown, but that would mean death for Tyrion. I still couldn #8217;t tell you for certain who I wanted to win. This epic battle for Winterfell may be the biggest battle ever filmed, but it will just the standard #8216;good vs evil #8217; trope. The heroes are all teaming up to fight a mindless horde of zombies. It #8217;s unfortunate in my opinion.

Really? Think back to the battle of the blackwater, when we were fully vested in the interests of both sides. We knew the motivations and fears of both sides. We understood what drove Stanis and what drove Tyrion. We got to see these complex characters challenge themselves and others. Would you rather see that? Or a standard #8216;good vs evil #8217; trope with mindless villains who have zero character?

I completely disagree. How many pages in the books are devoted to the White Walkers? How many pages are devoted to magic or dragon battles? Maybe 0.1%? Just because these things exist in the world that the story takes place in doesn #8217;t mean that they represent the main theme. Edit: Also, #8220;a disjointed narrative of random events #8221; is probably the most inaccurate description of ASOIAF I #8217;ve ever read. The White Walkers have had zero impact on the rest of the story in the books so far. They are definitely not the theme connecting all of the plot points together.

This whole thread has really surprised me. I didn #8217;t expect so many people to respond with, #8220;dragon vs zombie cgi battles are the best! That #8217;s what the show has always been about! #8221; It #8217;s like this thread is filled with people who only watched season 7.

I found a toonie ($2 coin in Canada) on the road that had been flattened by something. Not sure what could have done that to a coin, but it was about half the thickness of a normal toonie. Brought it to school and tried to spend it in the cafeteria, but they wouldn #8217;t take it. I saw my 9th grade science teacher and offered him a deal. #8220;I #8217;ll trade you a toonie for a loonie ($1 coin) #8221;, I said, but didn #8217;t show him the coin. He agreed and I grabbed his loonie, gave him the thin toonie, and walked away. The next day I get called into the principal #8217;s office where my 9th grade science teacher and the principal accuse me of money forgery. They said that I obviously had sawed the toonie in half, length wise. In other words, 2 adults, including a science teacher, claimed that I was in possession of some sort of laser saw capable of cutting a toonie clean in half, and my grand scheme to make money from this, was to saw toonies in half, and trade each half... for a loonie. They threatened to call the police. I called their bluff and ended up getting detention for #8220;lying #8221;. I still get mad thinking about this. Screw you Mr. Plus.

I don #8217;t care what colour they are (I #8217;m not saying you do), but I would bet anything that there are no father figures in the lives of these young men. When a young man has a stable father figure in their life, who is responsible, reliable, and a an active participant in their upbringing, this type of garbage doesn #8217;t happen. My father never hit me, but I know for sure, if I ever did something this horrible, he would have smacked the shit out of me. It #8217;s not the fear of that consequence that builds character. It #8217;s the respect a young man has for the man that raised him. Edit: There are countless people in this world who have been raised by single mothers, or female couples, who are great people. Perhaps my language was a bit too strict. That being said, having a respectable male role model is statistically a significant benefit to young men. There are countless studies that prove this. I #8217;ve linked one below, but I #8217;m happy to provide more. Look, I #8217;m not trying to say that women can #8217;t raise wonderful men. There #8217;s a LOT of evidence to the contrary. There are countless men in this world who were raised by single mothers who turned out great. All I #8217;m saying is that young men do significantly benefit from having a strong male role model. We just do. There is nothing sexist about stating that young men do better with positive male role models. It #8217;s the truth, and it #8217;s a GOOD thing. I #8217;m actually quite surprised by how many messages I #8217;ve received calling me sexist, racist, nazi, bigot, etc. Just because I stated that young men who have positive father figures in their lives typically don #8217;t act like horrible people. Is that such a crazy statement when every study and every bit of data ever collected backs it up? https://www.mnpsych.org/index.php?option=com_dailyplanetblog amp;view=entry amp;category=industry%20news amp;id=54:father-absent-homes-implications-for-criminal-justice-and-mental-health-professionals

I don #8217;t think you #8217;re understanding what I #8217;m saying. No, my dad never told me not to sucker punch and rob strangers on the street either. However, he did teach me to treat people with respect. He taught me to respect myself as well. Multiple times growing up I was able to witness him defuse tense situations with reason, respect, and empathy. I learned that violence is not the answer, but I also understand the importance of strength, when necessary. These are lessons that a young man MUST learn from a male role model. It doesn #8217;t need to be his dad, or even a single man, but it must be learned from elder male role model(s). Edit: evil like this is never common, when fathers are present.
What percentage of the population do you believe are #8220;bad apples #8221;, who are predetermined to commit violence, regardless of upbringing?

You trollin dude? Lol. This can #8217;t be real. Yes, there are good people with bad/no fathers, and there are bad people with good fathers. Furthermore, father figures, or a lack thereof, are not a direct indication of a child #8217;s likelihood to participate in shitty behaviour. There are a lot of really great people raised by singles moms in this world. However, every study ever done, every bit of data ever collected, has concluded that a lack of a father figure increases the likelihood of criminal and violent behaviour by a significant percentage. It #8217;s irrefutable. Perhaps it #8217;s not a good idea to jump to a conclusion, like I did with this case, but, the sad fact remains: I #8217;m probably right. The odds are drastically in my favour, unfortunately. Less fathers = more crime committed by young men. Fact. https://www.mnpsych.org/index.php?option=com_dailyplanetblog amp;view=entry amp;category=industry%20news amp;id=54:father-absent-homes-implications-for-criminal-justice-and-mental-health-professionals

There are countless people in this world who have been raised by single mothers, or female couples, who are great people. Perhaps my language was a bit too strict. That being said, having a respectable male role model is statistically a significant benefit to young men. There are countless studies that prove this. I #8217;ve linked one below, but I #8217;m happy to provide more. Look, I #8217;m not trying to say that women can #8217;t raise wonderful men. There #8217;s a LOT of evidence to the contrary. All I #8217;m saying is that young men do significantly benefit from having a strong male role model. We just do. There is nothing sexist about stating that young men do better with positive male role models. It #8217;s the truth, and it #8217;s a GOOD thing. https://www.mnpsych.org/index.php?option=com_dailyplanetblog amp;view=entry amp;category=industry%20news amp;id=54:father-absent-homes-implications-for-criminal-justice-and-mental-health-professionals

Many other people have messaged me saying something similar, and I completely understand. There are countless men in this world, raised by 1 or more women, who are wonderful people. There are also many men in this world who had wonderful fathers, who turned out to be shitty people. There #8217;s no perfect formula to raising young men who are empathetic, intelligent, and compassionate (traits that clearly the young men in the video do not possess). However, studies have shown, time and time again, that there is no better indicator to determine a young man #8217;s trajectory in life than the presence of a strong male role model. I #8217;ve linked one such study below, but I #8217;m happy to provide more, if you would like. Young men do better when they have positive male role models in their lives. That shouldn #8217;t be either surprising, or controversial. It #8217;s just common sense. https://www.mnpsych.org/index.php?option=com_dailyplanetblog amp;view=entry amp;category=industry%20news amp;id=54:father-absent-homes-implications-for-criminal-justice-and-mental-health-professionals

I #8217;m not sure what it is you #8217;re trying to say. Do you think it would be better if there was no male role model involved in the upbringing of young men? I #8217;m surprised that you #8217;re so passionately opposed to the concept that young men do better when a positive male role model exists in their lives. Why is that controversial to you?
You #8217;re right, a kid witnessing adults treat each other with respect, empathy, and compassion is the most positive influence there is.

I #8217;m not assuming anything. The #8220;studies and shit #8221; make a direct correlation between this type of behaviour and a lack of positive male role models. It #8217;s fact. I actually rejected the race factor in an earlier comment. You #8217;re the one making assumptions about race, not me.

All of that hard work that you do means that your son gets to go to a good school, where he very likely interacts with positive male role models. Studies show that male teachers are much more common at private schools than public (article linked below, but it #8217;s about the UK, because that data is more closely tracked in the UK and Canada than the US, though I would wager that the difference is bigger in the US). Young men benefit IMMENSELY from positive male role models, just like young women benefit from positive female role models. https://www.google.ca/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/teacher-network/teacher-blog/2014/oct/21/independent-schools-men-women-teachers-career-options

They #8217;re getting 100,000+ people per month. What is the US going to do with them all? Forget feeding them, where are you going to put them? https://www.washingtonpost.com/immigration/arrests-along-mexico-border-surged-again-in-may-blowing-past-breaking-point/2019/06/05/6d21585e-87a7-11e9-a491-25df61c78dc4_story.htmlq

What should be done with them? In May, 140,000+ people were caught crossing the boarder. That #8217;s just the amount the caught. How could any country possible deal with that? Forget the politics for a second. Logistically, how could any country possible deal with 140,000 per month, not including those who weren #8217;t caught. What would another president do? What are the options? This seems completely insane, and very frightening to me.

Then what? 140,000 people were caught crossing the board last month. What would you do with 140K+ people every month? Where would you put them? Is the housing market in America that underpopulated? How would you feed them? How would you give them healthcare? That #8217;s an INSANE amount of people to take care of. Are they just going to live on the street?

Almost non of them would qualify for refugee status. They are not fleeing war, they are seeking economic improvement (as would I in their shoes). So the question then is, do you change the refugee requirements to be basically anyone who wants to live in a #8220;better #8221; country? If you don #8217;t do that, what would you do with 130,000 people per month who don #8217;t qualify as refugees? Send them back to Mexico? They #8217;ll end up in mass camps in boarder towns. Eventually they #8217;ll storm the border. Edit: this is already happening. This has to stop. I don #8217;t care who the president is, this has got to stop. 140,000 per month (and that #8217;s just who they caught) is absolutely impossible to manage. https://www.washingtonpost.com/immigration/arrests-along-mexico-border-surged-again-in-may-blowing-past-breaking-point/2019/06/05/6d21585e-87a7-11e9-a491-25df61c78dc4_story.html

I don #8217;t know what the answer is, but I do know that processing them, in some way, is an absolute must. Just letting 140K+ per month (and that #8217;s just who they caught) over the boarder to live on the street will cause complete chaos. What would happen to the US boarder towns? Every single humanitarian service would collapse, almost immediately. You could be looking at an actual collapse of the US economy. It #8217;s impossible to just let that many people in with no plan on what to do with them. So yes, then need to be kept somewhere and processed, which is what is happening. https://www.washingtonpost.com/immigration/arrests-along-mexico-border-surged-again-in-may-blowing-past-breaking-point/2019/06/05/6d21585e-87a7-11e9-a491-25df61c78dc4_story.html The most annoying this about all of this is that any other president would be doing the EXACT same thing, and none of you would care. Obama did it. Did you care then? Every single president has said that the boarder needs to be secure. Why do you care now?

So what do you do with the 140,000+ people per month? Do you not process them in some way? Collect data, process their refugee claim? Make a plan for where they should go and where they should live? Or do you just let 140,000+ people flood into the streets of border towns, with no processing? I assume the answer to that is no, so then where do you put them while you process that insane amount of people? You can call it a #8220;concentration camp #8221; if you want, but it doesn #8217;t change the fact that they need to go somewhere while they are processed, and a plan is made for where to put them. Also, there is a LOT of human trafficking happening at the US border. Recent studies showed that 25% of children weren #8217;t actually the children of the people claiming to be their parents.

WRITING.TITLE: It #8217;s hard to convince someone you don #8217;t work for the city when you #8217;re wearing a High-Vis Vest.
WRITING.TEXT: This happened a few years ago, but I thought it would be perfect for this sub. My girlfriend was helping to organize a local charity walk, and asked me if I would volunteer to be a route guide. All I had to do was stand on a street corner and make sure that people doing the walk turned right at that intersection. They gave me a yellow vest and left me at the corner. It was 8am on a Saturday and the first charity walkers would take about 30min to get to my corner. So I got a coffee, and stood there, waiting. Unfortunately I didn #8217;t think ahead and bring a chair. I was standing on the corner for maybe 5min when this guy comes out of his house and walks over to me. Guy: #8220;Are you here about the intersection?! #8221; Me: #8220;No, I #8217;m volunteering for a charity walk #8221; Guy: #8220;You #8217;re with the city. You need to tell them to put in a roundabout! #8221; Me: #8220;Sorry but I don #8217;t work for the city, I #8217;m just volunteering for a... #8221; Guy: #8220;You #8217;re wearing a vest. You work for the city. You #8217;re here to investigate the intersection. #8221; (He didn #8217;t say any of this like it was a question, he was stating it like a fact) Me: #8220;Dude, I don #8217;t know what to tell you but I don #8217;t work for the city and I #8217;m just here to help with the charity walk. #8221; Guy (angry now): #8220;What charity walk?! #8221; He says as he spreads his arms out, showing how there are no people around. #8220;I know you #8217;re here for the intersection, and it #8217;s about damn time! I get cars on my lawn every week. We need a roundabout! #8221; Me: #8220;The charity walk that will be here in 20min. I #8217;m a route guide for a charity. I don #8217;t work for the city. Im just making sure that people turn right here. #8221; Guy: #8220;You wouldn #8217;t need a vest for that! Why would you be wearing a vest if you #8217;re not with the city?! You need to tell them to put in a roundabout. That #8217;s your job! #8221; Me: #8220;Alright dude, I #8217;ll tell them. No problem. #8221; Guy: #8220;There, was that so hard? #8221; He storms off back into his house. 20min later the charity walkers start arriving. One thing I should mention is that this charity walk was for children with pretty severe disabilities, so mixed in with the crowd were a lot of wheelchairs and walkers and other mobility assistance vehicles. I give a few high fives and tell a few people to turn right before this guy comes storming back out. Guy: #8220;You can #8217;t let these kids cross here! They #8217;re disabled and with no roundabout, it #8217;s dangerous! How could the city allow this?! #8221; A few of the parents and volunteers were caught off guard and give this guy a weird look. Also, in the 45min I #8217;d been there, maybe 10 cars had gone down his residential street. Me: #8220;I don #8217;t work for the city, and the kids seem to be doing just fine crossing the street. #8221; Guy: #8220;I don #8217;t care, you need to tell the city that we need a roundabout here! #8221; One of the people on the walk: #8220;Why don #8217;t you write the city a letter then? #8221; The guy storms off and I figured that would be the end of it, but nope, 10min later he comes back with a letter in hand, signed by him and his wife (I assume). Guy: #8220;Here! Give this to your boss. #8221; Me: #8220;Okay, no problem, will do. #8221; I don #8217;t remember what I did with the letter. I probably threw it out, but the best part is that about 6 months later, that intersection had a roundabout. Sometimes I wonder if that guy thinks it was my doing. TLDR: Wore a vest at a street corner. Couldn #8217;t convince a guy that I didn #8217;t work for the city.
Maybe I should go there wearing a vest, but just stand on the corner and wait for him to come out. Then I can tell him that we #8217;re investigating taking the roundabout out again.

Nothing in your comment is incorrect, which makes it even more sad that it was all a complete waste of time. This kata focused style of Kenjutsu has been proven to have literally zero benefit to actual combat, and even a beginner level fencer with a few weeks of training could beat him without breaking a sweat. Yoshio was big into aikido as well. It #8217;s all very sad, but it was only a matter of time before it was all exposed to be completely and utterly useless. I respect the man for keeping the art of the sword alive, but I do wonder if he himself knew that it was all fake.

I #8217;m not arguing any point made by the person I replied to. I even stated that he #8217;s correct, Yoshio probably spent thousands upon thousands of hours training kenjutsu kata and was very good at it. I was just making a comment. Not every comment on reddit is an argument. I was really into Kung fu movies when I was a kid. I also thought Aikido was awesome and even did a few classes. For that reason, it broke my heart when I learned it was all fake. So when I see videos like this, it makes me sad. Most people who see these types of videos actually believe that there is some practical usage to these traditional, mostly kata focused martial arts. Unfortunately there isn #8217;t. As an visual art form or a type of dance, sure, but there is no practical combat application, even though many people think there is. It makes me sad is all. It #8217;s like learning that Santa Clause isn #8217;t real.

I wasn #8217;t sad because movie martial arts is choreographed, I was sad because I didn #8217;t know that most traditional martial arts are completely fake. Most people still don #8217;t realize this. Even Bruce Lee, who did a lot of great things for Asian film representation and bringing martial arts to the west, wasn #8217;t a real fighter. It was all fake. The 1 inch punch was a trick he choreographed with his students. The one time he was challenged to do it with a real person, it had zero effect. He had 1 real fight than happened behind closed doors with only his students and his opponent #8217;s students to witness. It was a mess. There is footage of him hitting a punching bag, and it #8217;s sad, because it #8217;s clear he #8217;s never actually punched someone before. It #8217;s all fake and when I learned that, it made me sad, just like seeing this fake sword kata makes me sad.

WRITING.TEXT: The worst part about this decision is that the main story arcs weren #8217;t even concluded in Dance. The Battle of Fire and the Battle of Ice were written many, many years ago, and were intended to be the climax of the Feast/Dance book. George left them out, along with other climaxes, such as Cersie #8217;s trial, because Dance was getting to be too many pages, and he figured that since he already had so much of Winds written, he could just cut it out, because Winds would be released very shortly after Dance. When you look at it this way, George hasn #8217;t released an actual completed book in the ASOIAF series since Storm was released in the year 2000.
I love Feast. It #8217;s also my favourite. Jamie #8217;s chapters are my favourite chapters in the series.

I #8217;d have to do some digging, but George has stated that he intended to include the battles in Dance, and cut them last minute. However, knowing George, he #8217;s probably scrapped, and re-written them many times. They might not even be done right now lol. Regarding the Asha fragment, it #8217;s possible that George just opened WordStar for that clip, and that #8217;s the segment he happened to have open and was last working on. Based on his writing style, that #8217;s not an indication of whether that chapter had been written that week, or years earlier. I actually think that he had that part open on purpose, as he thought it would be a juicy bit for the fandom to theorize on.
Yes, but it #8217;s not just the battles. Most main character #8217;s arcs end on major cliffhangers. It #8217;s very painful.
